%%% This file is for setting the data used in the template
%%% It is intended that this file will be automatically generated in the future
%%%%%%%  DO NOT ADD ANYTHING ELSE TO THIS FILE
%%%%%%%  Use _Specification_AuthorSettings.tex for any additional features you wish to add

%%%---------------------------------
%%% INSTRUCTIONS
%%% The default submission document will be filled in with instructions in red italics
%%% when you first render it.  Feel free to print and refer to this initial version.
%%% Completing the setup in this file will remove the instructions and insert your
%%% technical content, which, initially, much will be blank.

%%% For each instance of {\REPLACEME{X}} in this file, substitute the appropriate
%%% information.  For instance:
%%% \setvalue{\specname}{\REPLACEME{Test Specification}}
%%% ->
%%% \setvalue{\specname}{Unified Modeling Language}
%%% As you replace the content, you may recompile/render your document, and see where
%%% the data is being inserted.

%%%---------------------------------
%%% Specification name, acronym, and version
%%% Ex: specname: Unified Modeling Language, specacro: UML, version: 2.5.2
\setvalue{\specname}{\REPLACEME{Test Spec}}
\setvalue{\specacro}{\REPLACEME{TS}}
\setvalue{\version}{\REPLACEME{0.9}}

%%%%% Cover page metadata
%%% Subtitle is optional - leave empty if you wish to have none
\setvalue{\subtitle}{\REPLACEME{Initial submission to TASKFORCE in Response to WHAT RFP (TASKFORCE/RFPDOCNUM)}}

%%% Submission date, use the OMG standard DD MONTHNAME, YYYY format
\setvalue{\subdate}{\REPLACEME{Submission Date}}

%%% Document number for this specification document, contact JÃ¼rgen Boldt at juergen@omg.org
%%% to request any needed document numbers
\setvalue{\docnum}{\REPLACEME{GET DOC NUM}}

%%% If this is an initial submission and requires Section 0, leave uncommented the line setting this to true.
%%% Otherwise, comment the true line, uncomment the line setting this to false, and Section 0 will be elided from the document.
\setboolean{initialsubmission}{true}
% \setboolean{initialsubmission}{false}


%%%---------------------------------
%%%%% Authorship Information
%%% Submitter and Copyright Information
\setvalue{\leadsubmitter}{\REPLACEME{Lead Submitter, Company X}}
\setvaluelist{\authornames}{{\REPLACEME{Company X}}, {\REPLACEME{Company Y}}}

%%% Submitters names and company info
%%% Follow this template for adding a specific company, person, and email:
% {Company Name\\Contact Name\\contact@info.org}
\setvaluelist{\submitterscontactinfo}{
{\REPLACEME{Company X\\John Smith\\john@companyx.com}}, 
{\REPLACEME{Company Y\\Dr. Jane Doe\\jdoe@companyy.com}}
}

%%% Inserted into the Author metadata of the resulting PDF
\setvalue{\pdfauthor}{\REPLACEME{Object Management Group}}


%%%---------------------------------
%%% Document metadata
%%%
%%% IRIs are the identification URIs for referencing this specification, and will 
%%% be placed in Section 0.1.3: Proposed Identification. 
%%% Consult with Juergen Boldt (boldt@omg.org) for guidance.
\setvaluelist{\iris}{{https://www.omg.org/spec/MOF2RDF/1.0}, {https://www.omg.org/spec/MOF2RDF/20181201}}

%%% If you have other document IRIs to place on the cover page, set them here.
%%% Consult with Juergen Boldt (boldt@omg.org) for guidance.
\setvaluelist{\otherdocnums}{{https://www.omg.org/spec/MOF2RDF/1.0}, {https://www.omg.org/spec/MOF2RDF/20181201}}

%%%---------------------------------
%%% IPR Mode
%%%
%%% Setting this will perform two final functions for you:
%%% 1) it properly insert the necessary IPR related boilerplate into your
%%% submission document in Section 0.1.2. Just choose the mode, and it does the rest.
%%% 2) it will remove the red italic instructions from throughout your document.
%%% Uncomment the below \setvalue line and replace '\xspace' with one
%%% of three values: rand, rflimited, or nonassert
% \setvalue{\iprmode}{\xspace}

\setvaluelist{\supporters}{}%{\REPLACEME{Company 1, Inc.}}, {\REPLACEME{Company 2, LLC}}}
